headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS....First Session; SENATE. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEBRASKA BILL. Numerous petitions against the Nebraska hill were presented from New-York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Ohio, Massachusetts, Illinois and Vermont. THREE INDIAN TERRITORIES. Mr JOHNSON introduced a bill to establish three Indian Territories west of Arkansas.
docs.snippet: THE NEBRASKA BILL. Numerous petitions against the Nebraska hill were presented from New-York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Ohio, Massachusetts, Illinois and Vermont. THREE INDIAN TERRITORIES. Mr JOHNSON introduced a bill to establish three Indian...

docs.lead_paragraph: NAVAL INTELLIGENCE.--The brig Reindeer MOULTON, from Coast of Africa, reports the U. S. ship Marion was off the Congo, on a cruise. The U. S. ship Constitution, Commodore MAYO, sailed for St. Helena about Nov. 25. Most of the English squadron were upon the North Coast, in consequence of some disturbance among the natives.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have received from Europe, by the Baltic, intelligence of the death of that remarkable tuan, SILVIO PELLICO, whose work, Le Mie Prigioni ("My Prisons") has been ran dated into every language in Europe, and made the name of the author almost a household word.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; DEBATES IN CONGRESS. General Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Quite a fluttering was occasioned in the Senate this afternoon, after Mr. DOUGLAS' amendment had been adopted, by an amendment offered by Mr. CHASE. The DOUGLAS amendment, it will be remembered, declares that it is not the intention of the bill to legislate Slavery into the Territories or to prohibit it therefrom, but to leave this and all other domestic questions to the decision of the people of the Territories, subject only to the Constitution.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N. Y. DAILY TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: Arrival of the Crescent City. The steamer Crescent City, Capt. R. BAXTER, arrived last night from New-Orleans Feb. 11, and Havana Feb. 14. We are indebted to M. L. PULTZ, Esq., her Purser, for memoranda.
docs.snippet: Arrival of the Crescent City. The steamer Crescent City, Capt. R. BAXTER, arrived last night from New-Orleans Feb. 11, and Havana Feb. 14. We are indebted to M. L. PULTZ, Esq., her Purser, for memoranda.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Poultry Exhibition at Barnum's--Address and conversazione. Court of Inquiry into the Conduct of Col. Gates and other officers on board the San Francisco--Twelfth Day.

docs.lead_paragraph: A meeting of the National Poultry Society was held on Friday morning in the Lecture-room of BARNUM'S Museum, for the purpose of considering the mode of rearing and the improvement of fowls. The President, Mr BARNUM made a few humerous remarks, and then introduced Mr. DAVID TAGGART, of Northumberland, Penn.

headline.main: THE NEWS FROM EUROPE.; Receipt of the Canada's Mails. Interesting Details Concerning the Eastern War. Further Particulars of Rev. Mr. Richmond in Austria. DEBATES IN PARLIAMENT. THE EASTERN QUESTION Prince Albert and the Government. INTERESTING DISCUSSIONS. The Russian Ambassador. The American Legation--Plain Dress. ENGLAND AND RUSSIA. Diplomatic Negotiations of the Two Powers. The Foreign Secretary to the British Ambassador at St. Petersburg. First Interview of the British Minister with Count Neaselrode. LETTER TO BE ADDRESSED BY THE BRITISH AND FRENCH ADMIRALS TO THE RUSSIAN ADMIRAL AT SEBASTOPOL. Translation. The Position and sentiments of Austria. Prussia and Austria. The Case of Rev. Mr. Richmond Continuation of his history of Austrian outrages. London Markets. Liverpool Markets. Street Prenching--A Letter from Mr. Parsons

docs.lead_paragraph: The Canada's mails reached us at an early hour yesterday morning. The summary of the intelligence by this arrival, which was received by Telegraph and published in the Times of Friday morning, was very full. We give below a variety of interesting extracts from our foreign files:

headline.main: HIGHLY IMPORTANT FROM EUROPE; ARRIVAL OF THE BALTIC. FOUR DAYS LATER NEWS. WAR! WAR!! WAR!!! Departure of the Russian Minister from London. SPIRITED DEBATE IN THE HOUSE OF LORDS. Cunard Steamers Detailed for the Conveyance of Troops. The Czar rejects the Sultan's Propositions. Communication between the ?? Russian Armies cut off. Preparations for War throughout Europe. 50,000 TURKS HAVE CROSSED THE DANUBE Three Million Cannon Balls Ordered by the French Government. COTTON STEADY-BREADSTUFFS DOWN. GREAT BRITAIN. THE WAR. The Count Orloff's Mission. The Army on the Danube. The Fleets. THE BALTIC. SERVIA. FRANCE. PRUSSIA. BELGIUM. AUSTRIA. ITALY. Miscellaneous Items.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Baltic, from Liverpool, Feb. 8, arrived this morning at 3:20. We are under obligations to the Purser, Mr. JAS. G. MAGLAN, for the early delivery of our foreign papers. The Baltic left Liverpool on Wednesday, Feb. 8, at 5 P. M. The weather has been generally fine--full cargo--and 56 passengers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several brutal and outrageous assaults by biped monsters on women, have come before the authorities of London. One, a Mr. FRANCIS WEBB, of Clarence-street, ??lington, was charged with having violently assaulted his wife with a red hot poker. Another case is that of a woman as??med FLYNN, who lies in a very precarious state from the injuries received from her husband.
